Activity-in-Diagram: Leach, Hydrometallurgy

Description

Notes:

Definitions:
Leaching – See A3324.

Standards:

References:
Chagnes, A., & Pospiech, B. (2013). A brief review on hydrometallurgical technologies for recycling spent lithium-ion batteries. Journal of Chemical Technology & Biotechnology, 88(7), 1191-1199.

Meshram, P., Pandey, B. D., & Mankhand, T. R. (2015). Hydrometallurgical processing of spent lithium ion batteries (LIBs) in the presence of a reducing agent with emphasis on kinetics of leaching. Chemical Engineering Journal, 281, 418-427.

Partinen, J., Halli, P., Wilson, B. P., & Lundström, M. (2023). The impact of chlorides on NMC leaching in hydrometallurgical battery recycling. Minerals Engineering, 202, 108244.

Pinegar, H., & Smith, Y. R. (2019). Recycling of end-of-life lithium ion batteries, Part I: Commercial processes. Journal of Sustainable Metallurgy, 5(3), 402-416.

Qing, J., Wu, X., Zeng, L., Guan, W., Cao, Z., Li, Q., ... & Wu, S. (2023). Novel approach to recycling of valuable metals from spent lithium-ion batteries using hydrometallurgy, focused on preferential extraction of lithium. Journal of Cleaner Production, 431, 139645.

Vieceli, N., Nogueira, C. A., Guimarães, C., Pereira, M. F., Durão, F. O., & Margarido, F. (2018). Hydrometallurgical recycling of lithium-ion batteries by reductive leaching with sodium metabisulphite. Waste Management, 71, 350-361.

Vieceli, N., Casasola, R., Lombardo, G., Ebin, B., & Petranikova, M. (2021). Hydrometallurgical recycling of EV lithium-ion batteries: Effects of incineration on the leaching efficiency of metals using sulfuric acid. Waste Management, 125, 192-203.

Owning Diagram: A333: Hydrometallurgy

Input

Slag

Alloy

Pretreated Battery Materials

Alkaline or Acid Solution

Flue Dust

Recirculated Leach Solution

Compounds (to Hydrometallurgy)

Output

Solid Material from Hydro Leaching

Organic Waste

Wastewater

Loaded Leach Solution

Control

Battery Chemistry
